item.title: Website Design for Columbia Bible College
item.description:
Website Editor, Jan 2024 - Present

Through my role as website editor at Columbia Bible College, I updated their WordPress site to align with an updated visual branding guide. This involved adjusting global site settings in the WordPress dashboard, and also hunting for custom CSS in the additional settings to locate conflicting code that was preventing proper functioning of global settings.

Primary Responsibilities

  • Website audit of every page to identify design inconsistencies
  • Managing ticketing inbox to maintain and update information across the site
  • Designing custom templates based on the visual brand guide
  • Drafting a documentation guide of the site infrastructure for future staff
  • Designing graphics and editing photos to add to the site
  • Strategizing and implementing updated website menu structure
  • Updating the site page by page for mobile optimization
  • Communicating with marketing staff and contractors to coordinate website maintenance and updates
  • Connecting analytics tracking for reporting purposes
  • Building analytics reports for executive staff and review with stakeholders (board members, donors, etc.)

Tools & Platforms

  • WordPress
  • Flywheel
  • Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign)
  • Canva
  • Gimp (photo editor)
  • Google Analytics
  • Google Search Console
  • Lighthouse
  • Looker Studio

item.title: Print Design for The Louden Singletree
item.description:
Nym is the last living nymph in the province of Galia, and Jay is out for her blood.

I write fantasy and science fiction and have a flair for gothic drama. The Nymph Keepers trilogy is my debut ebook series about Forest, a nymph whose people have been hunted to near-extinction for the healing properties in their blood. Jay needs nymph blood to help his sister, and Forest is supposed to be his solution to everything. Instead, Jay‚Äôs convictions war with his loyalties and he saves her from certain death, becoming a mercenary on the run in the process.

item.title: Visual Branding for The Tea Grannies Podcast
item.description:
Miraya Engelage and Elise Volkman bring you writing, editing, and reading tips from the tea-tables of their living rooms. Whether you’re an experienced author or new writer, pour yourself a cup of tea and join them for discussions on first drafts, querying, and everything in between.

The Work

  • Logo design
  • Website design on (Acast)
  • Monthly social media post design
  • Special occasion social media post design (events, giveaways, and special announcements)

The Story

Miraya and I met in 2018 when we both apparated into the Speculative Fiction cohort under the guidance of Eileen Cook. What started as a mandatory classmate connection turned into a friendship that transcends age, distance, and whatever other weird barriers society places on people. School cohort meetings morphed into a monthly writing group that we run together, that continues going strong to this day. At some point, we looked back and realized we‚Äôd been messaging each other daily ever since: about writing, editing, books, and therapy.

item.title: The Nymph Keepers Trilogy
item.description:
Nym is the last living nymph in the province of Galia, and Jay is out for her blood.

I write fantasy and science fiction and have a flair for gothic drama. The Nymph Keepers trilogy is my debut ebook series about Forest, a nymph whose people have been hunted to near-extinction for the healing properties in their blood. Jay needs nymph blood to help his sister, and Forest is supposed to be his solution to everything. Instead, Jay‚Äôs convictions war with his loyalties and he saves her from certain death, becoming a mercenary on the run in the process.

item.title: About Elise Volkman
item.description:
I love books and helping people. I’ll do whatever I can to make sure those worlds collide as often as possible.

The Backstory

People have always told me, ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre mature for your age,‚Äù and ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre an old soul.‚Äù Both very kind, empathetic ways of saying things like ‚ÄúWhat a dork!‚Äù or ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre such a nerd!‚Äù Thanks in part to those kind, empathetic words and people, I‚Äôve come to embrace my old soul (hence The Tea Grannies podcast and my frequent self-imposed use of the term ‚Äúhermit‚Äù). You can usually find me cradling warm mugs of tea, cuddled up in my reading chair with a blanket and a good book. Or crocheting a blanket. Or trying out a new cross-stitching pattern. Or lying on the floor to soothe my achy neck and back.

item.title: Contact
item.description:
I’m on hiatus from editing projects while I head back to school to complete my degree. Thanks for understanding üíú

To request a free sample edit, please include the following:

  • Title
  • Genre
  • Word count
  • A brief summary of your story
  • What kind of editing you’re looking for (and if you don’t know, that’s okay!)

For all other enquiries, a greeting and your message should do it. Feel free to tell me a bit about yourself too! I look forward to e-meeting you.

item.title: Services
item.description:
Website and Graphic Design services for the busy professional.

No sure what you need? No worries! You can request a free sample edit of your manuscript to see if we‚Äôll be a good fit. All I ask is that you have a completed draft of your story ready when you make your request.

Let‚Äôs Make Magic Together

The Budget Option: Manuscript Consultation

A manuscript consultation provides you with a high-level overview of how to strengthen and improve your story. This is a great budget option for authors who just need a little direction with where to start, or where to go next and aren’t ready for a full developmental edit yet (or can’t afford to pay for one).
